description:
The basic biodiversity thresholds were set at 20% of the area of each
ecosystem type. The 20% target is a default value commonly used in South Africa when targets derived
from the underlying characteristics (e.g. species area curves) of biodiversity features are not available. A
review of targets for marine systems is being undertaken by the South African National Biodiversity
Institute, which will inform target setting for marine ecosystems in the future.
name: Pelagic threat status classification
